info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 12:07AM EDT until July 10 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Wilkes and Yadkin.
* WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain from thunderstorms earlier this evening has exited the advisory area, leaving only steady light to occasionally moderate rainfall. However, between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell between 9 pm and 11 pm. Runoff from this rainfall continues to collect within local creeks and streams, holding them at or slightly above bankfull water levels. Localized minor flooding is expected to persist over the next few hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Swan Creek, Deep Creek, Arnold Branch, Cobb Creek, Harmon Creek, Cranberry Creek, Dugger Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Dobbins Creek, Davenport Creek, Ararat River and Bussels Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Boonville... East Bend... Brooks Crossroads... Nebo... Lone Hickory... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
